title: Record Label Logo Font
content:
I tried uploading the image but there seems to be an error message I can't get past. It's the 'SPECTRA-SOUND' font at the top of the record label I need to identify.

[http://images.45cat.com/the-buckinghams-usa-beginners-love-spectrasound.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/images.45cat.com/the-buckinghams-usa-beginners-love-spectrasound.jpg "http://images.45cat.com/the-buckinghams-usa-beginners-love-spectrasound.jpg")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [spectra sound font 3.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/typophile.com/files/spectra%20sound%20font%203.jpg) | 45.1 KB |
| [spectra sound font 2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/typophile.com/files/spectra%20sound%20font%202.jpg) | 21.17 KB |
author: CoyoteJames

comments.content:
SPECTRA-SOUND looks a good deal like Impact:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/search/Impact/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/Impact/fonts/ "http://www.myfonts.com/search/Impact/fonts/")

Sweets for My Sweet looks like Future Bold or Extra Black:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/futura/")

Thanks for the reply. Spectrasound is like IMPACT but it's not quite right. The O's are very different and I need to replicate the style using the text 'FOREVERMORE' which obviously features a few O's. The closest I have found is Helevetica Neue Condensed Bold but it's not exactly right either as it needs to be more compressed and taller.

CoyoteJames, I don't see a major difference between the O in your sample and Impact. Keep in mind, your image appears to be a bit distorted:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Impact_4184.png)

Okay, it appears your sample has a larger counter in the O than Impact has. If you substitute Impact's zero for its O, it is still a good approximation.

Placard MT Condensed Bold is another option:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/placard-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/placard-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/placard-mt/")

or Brown Gothic Black:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/shinntype/brown-gothic/black?SiteId=15](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.fonts.com/font/shinntype/brown-gothic/black?SiteId=15 "http://www.fonts.com/font/shinntype/brown-gothic/black?SiteId=15")

or Helvetica Inserat:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/")

or CG Triumvirate:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/monotype/cg-triumvirate/compressed?SiteId=15](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype/cg-triumvirate/compressed?SiteId=15 "http://www.fonts.com/font/monotype/cg-triumvirate/compressed?SiteId=15")

or Benton Sans:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/benton-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140906071930/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/benton-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/benton-sans/")
That's a good suggestion. I'll see how that works out. Thanks I really appreciate your help.
